group_1.textRight: ...So that's the long and short of it!

group_1.textLeft: I see...@that all makes sense.
Our club was only inaugurated a short time ago, and@we haven't actually accomplished anything with it.
Without any proof of our accomplishments within@the club, next semester's budget won't get approved.
Which means that the club could potentially be@disbanded next year.
...That's what the club advisor told you when you@met him in the hallway?
Would you mind explaining which part of that...
...leads to the "our precious club is getting shut@down!" conclusion?
Yeah, you skipped a lot of steps there.@The preconditions, for instance.

group_1.textRight: My apologies...@I'm not the best at explanations.

group_1.textLeft: But you're thinking "at least it got your attention!"@or something, right, Mihono?

group_1.narration: This is Seira Mihono.@She's our underclassman of one year here@in the school's senior division,@and the only first-year in the Historical Research Club.
She's a widely-acknowledged film aficionado,@and her dream is to direct films herself one day.

group_1.textLeft: I mean, it's only natural. We've been meeting@face-to-face here on pretty much a daily basis.

group_1.textRight: Although I'm hardly as skilled at tacit communication@as you are with each other, senpais!

group_1.textLeft: That's 'cause Kira and I have known each other@since we were kids.

group_1.narration: This is Mikura Komachi.@She's the president of the Historical Research Club,@my fellow senior in second year, and my childhood friend.
We live in a neighboring town to Kamihama,@and attend school together via train.
She adores history, and quite possibly knows more about@Kamihama's local history than the average expert does.
It was only a short while ago that@she discovered a kofun near our school,@and became a bit of a local news sensation.
My name is Temari Kira.@I'm fond of poems, novels—@all literature in general, really.
I suppose you could say@I'm the club's designated literature buff.

group_1.textLeft: ...So, back on topic. Essentially...
We just need to record some sort of actual club@activity before next year, right?

group_1.textRight: ...I suppose they've noticed how we haven't actually@DONE any activities?

group_1.textLeft: Huh? ...I'm at least getting work done on my local@history essay.

group_1.textRight: And I'm researching cinematic history by watching@films here on a daily basis!
Not to mention Kira-senpai and her constant@devotion to literary history research!

group_1.textLeft: Komachi aside...
You're JUST watching films, Mihono.@And I'm just reading, yes?

group_1.textRight: Always the blunt one, huh, Kira-senpai...

group_1.textLeft: Of course, we're all on the same page about what we@want to do here, so it's not a problem or anything.
You remember our promise when we established@the club, right?

group_1.textRight: The "Historical Research Club" is merely the facade@we use to lay low from the world!
Here, we both pursue our chosen fields to our@hearts' content...
...and work together to aid one another in our@endeavors as Magical Girls!

group_1.textLeft: ...Exactly.

group_1.narration: Indeed—@we three members of the Historical Research Club@are actually all Magical Girls.
We each made our wishes@and became Magical Girls@right at the same time...

group_1.textCenter: (Thinking back on it, when each of us made our@contracts...)
(...we each did so with a wish that suited us very@well.)

group_1.narration: A short time after that,@Mihono announced that she@"wanted to have a more normal@high-school club experience!".
But since balancing a club schedule with Magical Girl@activities would be difficult, the three of us decided@to make a new club of our own.

group_1.textLeft: ...Though our Magical Girl circle may be a@"Historical Research Club" in name only...
We DID fast-track our application thanks to@Komachi's name recognition...
...and rent out this entire empty classroom.
So I'd like to make a good show of doing a@history-related club activity... even if it's just FOR@show.

group_1.textRight: Kira-senpai! You!@...Could at least describe it a bit more delicately!

group_1.textLeft: The fact that she didn't call it a "fake club" already@sounded plenty delicate to me?
